WARNING: VERY LONG if you even START to read this.... don't unless you intend to read it ALL the way through, NO skimming. IF you read this.... listen to what I have said, take it into your life, and relationships. It is important and it should be read.... but since it is so lengthy.... unless you intend to READ it: Stop here. if you really intend to read it: don't do it when you are tired and can't think straight. You wont understand. I know I havn't been a very honest person in the past, and I know I made a lot of mistakes, but now I know that honesty is the biggest thing in a relationship. If one person doesn't tell the other something.... no matter how small, it will infringe on the relationship, and hurt trust. Big things make it harder for one person to trust the other again, but in time the trust is repaired. Situations like that..... the situation will never be ok, but the person who was the victim in the situation, will eventualy heal, and trust the other again, letting their ties be ok, even if the situation was not. Everone deserves a second chance..... especially if you love them. And even if one person is still keeping something from the other, that other person will trust them about everything, and hope that the other person is in fact telling the truth. Holding on by a limb, the other person will hold on until that limb iether breaks, or until they can climb back up again. If someone trusts you, you should never lie to them.... if someone trusts you, you should tell them the truth about everything, even if it seems like the other person may be angry once they know the truth. The truth should be told in the first place, otherwise it causes more pain than should EVER be caused. and if there are things that you still hold secret from that person who trusts you, and loves you.... you're not only hurting them, but yourself as well. You never know when the other may find out about something that you're keeping secret. If you have secrets from the one you love, then maybe you don't really love them or know them like you think. If you REALLY TRUELY love the person your with.... you'll tell them EVERYTHING you are hiding, no matter how small it is. What has happened in the past month has tought me that. I myself never meant to lie, I myself have made bad descisions, but afterward, when I finaly spoke with Kaity about those things.... I told her EVERYTHING she wanted to know. And I trust she's doing that for me now.... even if she wasn't... I still love her and trust her, and I wouldn't be angry if she told me anything else. But I know in my heart there isn't anything else left out, and she deserves another chance. I love her too much NOT to give her another chance. I'm holding on to a limb, yes..... but I'm willing to go out on that limb and climb my way back on it. I know from this, I will not keep any secrets from Kaity like I did before. I'm done lying to her, and I'm done fighting with her, and I'm done keeping secrets from her. I want this all to be over. I trust everything. Maybe I'm naieve for doing that..... maybe love has made me blind. But I trust her and she deserves a chance. I just hope that it's all over. I hope that I know everything.... but like I said..... even if I don't, and I found something else out that Kaity kept secret, I wouldn't be angry, and I'd just be glad I knew the truth. But I trust her, and I know that there's nothing else I need to worry about between us. I'm getting this all off my chest. I've learned the lesson I've stated above, and I trust Kaity has too. These are our bonds..... love..... and TRUST. That's what a relationship is supposed to be. Without trust, and truth in a relationship... it's not worth staying in, unless you can fix it. And after you fix it once.... it should never happen again, or continue after the trust has been mended between the pair. No lies, No secrets, No fear of the other, Love, Understanding, And Passion... those are the ingredients for a truely workable relationship. If you truely love one another, you'll never keep secrets..... because you should not be afraid of what the other person will do.... if they love you, they will understand and work it out with you, they wont blow up like some sort of maniac and break off the relationship. If they love you..... the secrets no matter how big or small will not matter, and you WILL be able to work it out. But if you keep secrets from the one you love, and you lie to them.... then you don't love them as much as you say you do. All in all..... Tell the truth, don't leave out things, don't keep secrets, and don't lie again when you get caught IF you lie in the first place.... Come out straight up, and tell the truth. If the person your with truely loves you. They'll talk to you, and work it out, and try to understand..... But if you keep a secret, let it go too far, and have the person you love find out the hard way.... it only causes them MORE pain. Especially if you continue to lie, and leave out details. All-in-all.... if you love them, you wont lie, and if they love you.... no matter what you tell them..... it wont matter, as long as you can talk it out and not fight, or yell or get angry. It's all just trust. I love you Kaity. And I wrote this so you know how much I trust you now. I wrote this because it's the way I feel, and it's the way I want to do things from now on. I want us both to be completely honest, and I'm going to look at this entry as many times as I can to tell you if I have somethng that needs to be said. I have no secrets from you anymore, I havn't meant to lie to you, I havn't meant to hurt you, and I havn't meant to keep brooding on the events of this past month. I trust you completely again, and I love you completely, I always have. It's never changed. I may have been agry with you a few times, but I never stopped loveing you. If there's anything.... EVER..... that you're afraid of telling me..... don't be, I wont flip out as long as you just tell me. You don't have to be afraid of my reactions baby. I just want the truth from you from now on, and I will give it to you as well.... and I want you to keep me to that, just like I'm keeping you to the promise you made. I know everything will work out..... just tell me if you have a secret that you would normaly think I'd blow up on, or whatever.... just tell me the truth, and I promis I won't freak, I'll just talk to you about it. I promise.... I promise I'll do the same if there's anything that you need to know. No matter how small or big.... I WILL tell you. I'm done lying, and I trust you are too. I love you. Forever and always. I always have, I never lost one bit of that feeling for you through all this. I mean it with everything I am, and all of myself, and everything that I could ever give you....... I LOVE YOU! Only YOU! FOREVER. We just have to be honest from now on. We can't hurt eachother anymore, we can't keep things from eachother anymore. No matter how things play out in our heads.... we should tell the other what's gong on. No matter how big the situation, no matter what..... no more lies, no matter what..... no more being afraid of what iether of us will do. If we love eachother.... we can, and will work it out, no matter what it is. I'm done with all the pain, I'm done with hurting you, I'm done being untrusting over this.... as long as your totaly honest with me.... just as I will be with you..... we never have to worry. I love you baby. I want you to know that. And because of it..... I wrote this. And it's late.... so I hope I worded it so that is sounds just like I meant it. I love you kaity..... no more.... no more fighting, and distrust. I just want everything to be right. Read this from time to time, just as I will to remind yourself of what we have, of who I am, and of what I feel for you. I hope you know that you can come to me with anything. Even if it's something big, or small. I just want the truth.... just like you do. I want to make things right.... and I need your help to do it. I love you.

I'm getting my act together now *Smashes head with keyboard* there we go... I just need to do it. I mean yeah, so it doesn't give me a lot of time to do the stuff I want, but in the long run.... it'll be worth it. I need to fix it. I need to do it, and quit kidding myself.               I've been trying to figure everything out, with my parents and all. I thought they were breathing down my neck, but I realize it's them just trying to help, just trying to scare me into fixing it, just them giving me advice, and I just need to take it and stop being defensive. I put too much stress on them, and they don't need it. It's MY stress, I need to keep it to myself and not let it off on ANYONE. I need to loosen it for myself. I need to clear my mind, and fix the problem inside of me..... laziness. I was beginning to become jaded from all of it, but now i think I know what to do. I NEED to go to college, and i NEED to save up money... (after this month) so I can help pay for an appartment, my insurance, utilities, food, and college. I need a better plan that what I had before, I was just letting things happen to me, I was living day-by-day.... no more, I'm done worrying.... only I can fix it. I need to look twenty miles down the road, I need to look to how my future will be if I don't get myself together. 

My priorities come as follows:
1.) Kaity, and giving her the future she deserves by fixing it now.
2.) Getting my lisence... It will happen, but my main focus is life, preparing for it, preparing to make it better
3.)My job, i need the money
3.5)friends. Sorry if that offends anyone, but I can't help that I'm worried about what's going to happen AFTER high school. There'll be time to hang out, but not as often as it used to be.
4.)The little stuff, It'll come to me on it's own, the reward of working hard.

I need to fix it now, need to fix my future from the damage I've done to it by not doing my work. I need to fix it NOW.

Suprisingly, I'm calm about this, it's a big deal, but I know I can do it.

A philosophy professor stood before his class and had
 some items in front of him. When the class began,
 wordlessly he picked up a large empty mayonnaise jar
 and proceeded to fill it with rocks, rocks about 2
 inches in diameter.  He then asked the students if the
 jar was full. They agreed that it was. So the
 professor then picked up a box of pebbles and poured
 them into the jar.  He shook the jar lightly. The
 pebbles,of course, rolled into the open areas between
 the rocks. He then asked the students again if the jar
 was full.  They agreed it was.

 The students laughed. The professor picked up a box of
 sand and poured it into the jar. Of course, the sand
 filled the remaining space between the pebbles and the
 rocks. "Now," said the professor, "I want you to
 recognize that this is your life.  The rocks are the
 important things - your family, friends, your partner,
 your health, your children - things that if everything
 else was lost and only they remained, your life would
 still be full. The pebbles are the other things that
 matter like your job, your house, your car. The sand
 is everything else.  The small stuff."

 "If you put the sand into the jar first, there is no
 room for the pebbles or the rocks. The same goes for
 your life. If you spend all your time and energy on
 the small stuff, you will never have room for the
 things that are important to you.  Pay attention to
 the things that are critical to your happiness. Play
 with your children. Take time to get medical checkups.
 Take your partner out dancing. There will always be
 time to go to work, clean the house, give a dinner
 party and fix the disposal. Take care of the rocks
 first - the things that really matter. Set your
 priorities. The rest is just sand."

 But then ...

 A student took the jar which the other students and
 the professor agreed was full, and proceeded to pour
 in a glass of beer. Of course the beer filled the
 remaining spaces within the jar making the jar truly
 full.

 Which proves: no matter how full your life is,there is
 always room for a beer.
